Title: An Angel at My Table
Writer: Janet Frame (autobiographical books "To the Is-Land",  "An Angel at My Table" and "The Envoy from Mirror City"), Laura Jones (screenplay)
Actors: Kerry Fox, Alexia Keogh, Karen Fergusson, Iris Churn
Plot: In 1920s and 1930s New Zealand, Janet Frame grows up in a poor family with lots of brothers and sisters. Already at an early age she is different from the other kids. She gets an education as a teacher but since she is considered abnormal she stays at a mental institution for eight years. Success comes when she starts to write novels.
